dt: {bc}a biennial garden plant ({it}Beta vulgaris{/it}) of the goosefoot family that includes several cultivars (such as Swiss chard and sugar beet) and that has thick edible leaves with long petioles and often swollen purplish-red roots
{bc}its root used especially as a vegetable, as a source of sugar, or for forage

et: Middle English {it}bete{/it}, from Old English {it}bēte{/it}, from Latin {it}beta{/it}
shortdef: a biennial garden plant (Beta vulgaris) of the goosefoot family that includes several cultivars (such as Swiss chard and sugar beet) and that has thick edible leaves with long petioles and often swollen purplish-red roots; also : its root used especially as a vegetable, as a source of sugar, or for forage

dt: {bc}an armyworm ({it}Spodoptera exigua{/it}) that typically eats the foliage of beets, alfalfa, and vegetables

shortdef: an armyworm (Spodoptera exigua) that typically eats the foliage of beets, alfalfa, and vegetables

dt: {bc}a leafhopper ({it}Circulifer tenellus{/it}) that transmits curly top virus to sugar beets and other garden plants

shortdef: a leafhopper (Circulifer tenellus) that transmits curly top virus to sugar beets and other garden plants

dt: {bc}red in the face especially from embarrassment

dt.t: When she realized her mistake, she turned {phrase}beet red{/phrase}.

shortdef: red in the face especially from embarrassment

dt: {bc}a white-rooted beet grown for the sugar in its roots

shortdef: a white-rooted beet grown for the sugar in its roots
